pr_title: Feature | Added support for authentication to Azure Key Vault using Managed Identity

timeline.message: Fix AEv2 tests exclude for reqExternalSetup and cleanup (#1247)
Fix | Add null check for getObject() with LocalTime and LocalDate (#1250)

added all AKV tests to use reqExternalSetup tag so they will be skipped by default (#1254)

* skip AKV test properly

* removed enclave properties string to failed errors as enclave tests could be skipped
added new props for AKV with MSI

timeline.body: Why are we wrapping the exception into a RuntimeException here? Shouldn't we wrap the exception into a SQLServerException instead?
timeline.bodyText: Why are we wrapping the exception into a RuntimeException here? Shouldn't we wrap the exception into a SQLServerException instead?
timeline.bodyHTML: Why are we wrapping the exception into a RuntimeException here? Shouldn't we wrap the exception into a SQLServerException instead?
timeline.author: peterbae

replies.bodyText: should we? I used RuntimeException to be consistent with what we're currently doing already.  getAccessTokenFromClientCredentials throws RuntimeException which just gets passed up to the caller here
replies.author: lilgreenbird

replies.bodyText: ok, I see that it's being done in the other method as well...but I think we usually wrap any exception into SQLServerException. But I'm ok with following the previous code.
replies.author: peterbae

timeline.author: peterbae

timeline.body: I think currently your testing might not be testing the correct inputs from the user. This AETestConnectionString is a static variable that keeps getting added more parameters as individual tests get executed, resulting in latter tests having the same connection property defined multiple times. You should reset this variable to the base connection string at the beginning of each test run.
timeline.bodyText: I think currently your testing might not be testing the correct inputs from the user. This AETestConnectionString is a static variable that keeps getting added more parameters as individual tests get executed, resulting in latter tests having the same connection property defined multiple times. You should reset this variable to the base connection string at the beginning of each test run.
timeline.bodyHTML: I think currently your testing might not be testing the correct inputs from the user. This AETestConnectionString is a static variable that keeps getting added more parameters as individual tests get executed, resulting in latter tests having the same connection property defined multiple times. You should reset this variable to the base connection string at the beginning of each test run.

timeline.body: This is not necessarily AKV user principal ID. Please align the docs with [ODBC connection property documentation.](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/connect/odbc/using-always-encrypted-with-the-odbc-driver?view=sql-server-ver15#using-the-azure-key-vault-provider)

+     *        When keyStoreAuthentication = keyVaultClientSecret, set this value to a valid Azure Active Directory Application Client ID.
+     *        When keyStoreAuthentication = keyVaultManagedIdentity, set this value to a valid Azure Active Directory Application Object ID (optional, for user-assigned only).
+     *
*/ - void setKeyStorePrincipalId(String keyVaultPrincipalId); + void setKeyStorePrincipalId(String keyStorePrincipalId); /** - * Returns the value for the connection property 'keyVaultPrincipalId'. + * Returns the value for the connection property 'keyStorePrincipalId'. * - * @return keyVaultPrincipalId + * @return keyStorePrincipalId */ String getKeyStorePrincipalId();

commits_in_main.message: Added connectRetryCount and connectRetryInterval to SQLServerDatasource (#1546)
Add optional realm connection string property for Kerberos authentication (#1581)
Deprecate and Rename Service principal connection properties (#1693)
Added new connection string property prepareMethod to toggle use of sp_prepare (#1719)
Add serverCertificate connection property for encrypt=strict (#1773)
Added getters and setters for new msiTokenCacheTtl connection prop (#1842)
More fixes for SonarQube warnings and coding standards (#1969)
Fixes #1590 - [FEATURE REQUEST] Ability to explicitly specify conversion to datetime or datetime2  (#1687)
More code clean up to fix SonarQube issues (#1977)
Added access token callback class connection string property (#2073)

timeline.body: Please do not call class.getName() in logger, it traverses the stack and is extremely costly performance-wise. I also recommend checking the logging level before calling these entering/exiting methods, although I'm not sure if the intent here is to always log. As for the class.getName(), just use a static string, so SQLServerConnection.class.getName() would be "com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerConnection".
timeline.bodyText: Please do not call class.getName() in logger, it traverses the stack and is extremely costly performance-wise. I also recommend checking the logging level before calling these entering/exiting methods, although I'm not sure if the intent here is to always log. As for the class.getName(), just use a static string, so SQLServerConnection.class.getName() would be "com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerConnection".
timeline.bodyHTML: Please do not call class.getName() in logger, it traverses the stack and is extremely costly performance-wise. I also recommend checking the logging level before calling these entering/exiting methods, although I'm not sure if the intent here is to always log. As for the class.getName(), just use a static string, so SQLServerConnection.class.getName() would be "com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerConnection".

timeline.body:
From ODBC docs, keyStorePrincipalId description:

When KeyStoreAuthentication = KeyVaultPassword, set this value to a valid Azure Active Directory User Principal Name.
When KeyStoreAuthetication = KeyVaultClientSecret set this value to a valid Azure Active Directory Application Client ID
timeline.bodyText:
From ODBC docs, keyStorePrincipalId description:
When KeyStoreAuthentication = KeyVaultPassword, set this value to a valid Azure Active Directory User Principal Name.
When KeyStoreAuthetication = KeyVaultClientSecret set this value to a valid Azure Active Directory Application Client ID

*/

timeline.body: Login failed? This catch block implies that, the only exception that can happen inside try block is due to a login failure. Just remove the catch block and let the test throw the original exception.
